episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including espionage techniques using light bulbs, the history of London Bridge and its destruction by a tornado, the cancellation of a Dutch cycling race due to excessive wind, and the use of sterilized flies to control pest populations on the Colombia-Panama border.

facts.fact: Spies can tell what people are saying by looking at the lights in the room they're in.
London Bridge was destroyed by a tornado in 1091.
This year's Dutch national headwind championships was canceled during the race because it was too windy.
Every week planes drop 15 million flies on the border between Columbia and Panama.
